page.title: 08Schools in SE Derby
page.content: Schools occupy large areas of this part of Derby. Some of them were built for the old Borough of Derby which was rapidly expanding, so the only sites available were on what was adjacent rural land. Since the 1970's the secondary schools have become{neighbourhood {comprehensive}schools for this part of Derby. Noel-Baker School is now one of the largest schools in the county with over 1750 pupils, while the nearby Merrill School has recently become a {community school}offering courses for people of all ages. Not far away St Thomas Moore School, which provides a Catholic education for the southern half of the Derby, reflects a current trend. It is soon to close as a result of declining numbers following a drop in the{Birth Rate}in the 1970's.
